intro: Clidemia gracilis, commonly known as silverleaf or velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it a silvery appearance. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Clidemia gracilis produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, which bloom during the rainy season.
